intro: Ononis crispa subsp. zschackei, commonly known as the alpine bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has finely toothed leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions, growing in rocky or gravelly soils. This subspecies is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
